p: Geranyl acetate (97.0% purity) and citral (95.0% purity), identified as constituents of the lemongrass essential oil, were obtained from Sigma Aldrich (Darmstadt, Germany). The efficacy of these constituents was determined by their lethal doses (LD 50 and LD 90) in the laboratory. Six different doses of each constituent were prepared and used to assess the insecticide toxicity and determine relevant toxicological endpoints; a dilution series of doses (8.1, 16.2, 31.2, 62.5, 125, and 250 µg/insect −1) was used to determine dose-mortality relationship and lethal dose. Acetone was used as a control. Each solution (1 μL) was applied to the thorax of third-instar nymphs using a micropipette. Fiften nymphs were tested, placed individually in Petri dishes with one T. molitor pupa per day, and cotton soaked with water. The number of dead nymphs in each Petri dish was counted after 36 h.
